item.title: Faculty Spotlight on Research & Impact - Special Edition - Joel Giedt - Decoding the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics: From Tilted Washboards to Bond Trading | Oct. 31
item.description: Date: Friday, October 31, 2025 2:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Can something you can see with your eyes behave like a quantum particle? The 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics honored John Clarke, Michel Devoret, and John Martinis for proving that even large electrical circuits can follow quantum rules. Their discovery paved the way for today’s quantum computers, including the IBM Quantum System One right here at RPI. Prof. Giedt will help explain how their seminal work transformed physics and opened the door to a…

item.title: 10/29 Cognitive Science Colloquium: “Logic as Applied Mathematics” with Dr. Graham Priest
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department on Wednesday, October 29th, at 12pm in Carnegie 113 for a presentation by Dr. Graham Priest titled “Logic as Applied Mathematics”. Dr. Priest is currently Distinguished Professor of Philosophy at the Graduate Center, City University of New York, Boyce Gibson Professor Emeritus at the University of Melbourne, and has visiting positions at the Ruhr University of Bochum (Germany), Tohoku University (Japan), and Shandon University (China).

item.title: Webinar: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System | Oct. 30
item.description: Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, will present an overview of Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management (DAM) System on Thursday October 30, from 11am-Noon. item.title: RPI now has access to the full IEEE Electronic Library
item.description: The RPI Libraries are pleased to announce that the RPI community now has full access to the IEEE Electronic Library (IEL), which provides full-text IEEE content published since 1988, with select content dating back to 1884, from journals, conferences, transactions, magazines, standards, and more.

item.title: iEAR Presents: Decolonial Practices in Film Workshop with Suneil Sanzgiri | Oct. 29
item.description: Join us Oct 29 starting at 4:30pm at the Sanctuary for Independent Media. The program opens with a workshop session on film practice. Sanzgiri and Suchak/ Youth FX reflect on the practical work of filmmaking and consider its impact on the histories and communities it engages. The workshop is followed by a dinner for participants, and a concluding screening of works from Sanzgiri’s series Golden Jubilee.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar – “Certifications & Skill Development in Percipio”
item.description:
This course introduces the tools available in Percipio to support growth through certifications and skill benchmarks. You’ll learn how to identify relevant certifications and use benchmark assessments to measure current knowledge. Perfect for employees and supervisors alike, this session will help you navigate the platform’s upskilling features and align learning with career development objectives.
